intro: Rorippa amphibia, commonly known as the water cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are often submerged or floating in water. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It is an aquatic or semi-aquatic species, often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. Rorippa amphibia is known for its ability to thrive in moist environments and is sometimes used as a leaf vegetable in various cuisines.
